event.title: Classes resume
event.description: With the new year comes new training.

event.title: Misogi
event.description: Our annual opportunity to ring in the new year. Open to all current students. Annual new year's party to follow at 11:00.
event.start_time: arrive by 8:30 am, misogi starts at 9:00 am

event.title: Kiatsu class with Tabata Sensei
event.description: Advanced Kiatsu training with Tabata Sensei for active Kiatsu School participants.

event.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
event.description: No classes due to holiday

event.title: Memorial service for Jake Nice Sensei
event.description: We invite all students to join us in paying our respects to Jake Nice Sensei who recently passed away. The memorial service will be followed by a reception

event.title: Kiatsu seminar #3
event.description: Seminar #3 is open to all current Kiatsu students and graduates. Advanced Ki-Aikido students and instructors (brown and black belts) are invited to attend the Saturday session.

event.title: Kiatsu class with Tabata Sensei
event.description: Advanced Kiatsu training with Tabata Sensei for active Kiatsu School participants.

event.title: President's day weekend
event.description: No classes over on holiday Sunday or Monday.

event.title: Kiatsu class with Tabata Sensei
event.description: Advanced Kiatsu training with Tabata Sensei for active Kiatsu School participants.

event.title: Instructors' workshop #1
event.description: The workshop will focus on teaching skills for aikido instructors currently teaching a class, with feedback from Tabata sensei. Details TBA.

event.title: Kiatsu class with Tabata Sensei
event.description: Advanced Kiatsu training with Tabata Sensei for active Kiatsu School participants.

event.title: Instructor's class with Tabata Sensei
event.description: Advanced training with Tabata Sensei for all instructors, including an hour of Kiatsu practice.
event.start_time: 10 am to 2 pm, with Kiatsu between 11 and noon

event.title: Taigi Shinsakai
event.description: The children's competition will be in the morning, with the adults in the afternoon. Viewing is open to the public.

event.title: No class
event.description: Because of the Shinsakai, there will be no morning Ki class.

event.title: Kiatsu class with Tabata Sensei
event.description: Advanced Kiatsu training with Tabata Sensei for active Kiatsu School participants.

event.title: Instructor's class with Tabata Sensei
event.description: Advanced training with Tabata Sensei for all instructors, including an hour of Kiatsu practice.
event.start_time: 10 am to 2 pm, with Kiatsu between 11 and noon

event.title: Kiatsu class with Tabata Sensei
event.description: Advanced Kiatsu training with Tabata Sensei for active Kiatsu School participants.

event.title: Randori class
event.description: The usual advanced aikido class will cover randori. All students brown belt and up are encouraged to attend.

event.title: Easter
event.description: No classes because of the holiday.

event.title: Spring camp
event.description: One of two annual opportunities to train Aikido intensively, Spring camp is open to all current students.
event.start_time: 9:00 am on Saturday, 7:30 am on Sunday

event.title: No class
event.description: Because of Spring camp, there will be no morning Ki class.

event.title: Board test
event.description: Testing for brown and black belts
event.start_time: following morning Ki class at noon

event.title: Mother's day
event.description: No classes because of the holiday.

event.title: Kiatsu seminar #4
event.description: Seminar #4 is open to all current Kiatsu students and graduates. Advanced Ki-Aikido students and instructors (brown and black belts) are invited to attend the Saturday session.

event.title: Memorial day weekend
event.description: No classes on Sunday or Monday because of the holiday.

event.title: Instructors' workshop #2
event.description: The workshop will focus on teaching skills for aikido instructors currently teaching a class, with feedback from Tabata sensei. Details TBA.

event.title: Kids' camp
event.description: The annual kids' camp is this weekend, featuring lots of training and activities for members of the children's program.

event.title: Regional Ki Seminar
event.description: The North American Ki Seminar is being held at Furman University in Greenville, South Carolina this year. The seminar is open to all, but students brown belt and up are encouraged to attend.

event.title: No classes
event.description: Because of kids' camp, there will be no morning Ki class.

event.title: Fourth of July weekend
event.description: No classes because of the holiday.

event.title: Instructors' workshop #3
event.description: Instructors from Japan and the U.K will be joining us for a workshop focused on teaching skills for aikido instructors, with feedback from Tabata sensei. Details TBA.

event.title: Labor day weekend
event.description: No classes because of the holiday.

event.title: Randori class
event.description: The usual advanced aikido class will cover randori. All students brown belt and up are encouraged to attend.

event.title: Kiatsu seminar #5
event.description: Seminar #5 is open to all current Kiatsu students and graduates. Advanced Ki-Aikido students and instructors (brown and black belts) are invited to attend the Sunday session.

event.title: Board test
event.description: Testing for brown and black belts
event.start_time: following morning Ki class at noon

event.title: Japan National Instructor Camp
event.description: Instructors are invited to Ki Society Headquarters in Japan for this intensive camp.

event.title: Instructors' workshop #4
event.description: The workshop will focus on teaching skills for aikido instructors currently teaching a class, with feedback from Tabata sensei. Details TBA.

event.title: Kiatsu seminar #1
event.description: Seminar #1 is open to all current Kiatsu students and graduates. Advanced Ki-Aikido students and instructors (brown and black belts) are invited to attend the Sunday session.

event.title: Fall camp
event.description: One of two annual opportunities to train Aikido intensively, Fall camp is open to all current students.
event.start_time: 9:00 am on Saturday, 7:30 am on Sunday

event.title: Thanksgiving
event.description: No classes over the holiday weekend.

event.title: Thanksgiving weekend
event.description: No classes on Thanksgiving Sunday.

event.title: Management conference
event.description: All instructors are invited to attend the annual management conference.

event.title: Last day of classes
event.description: No classes will be held over the holiday break.

event.description: With the new year comes new training.
